q: broadcast media reports on Sunday, Brown asked police to investigate whether his phone had been hacked when he was prime minister between 2007 and 2010. Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman said police must investigate the allegations. Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced, she told Sky News. Dallas Morning News: Attempts to rein in homeowners associations have failed in the state Legislature for more than a decade, but a rise in HOA foreclosures and a spate of public lawsuits have invigorated supporters, who see this session as their chance for reform. Legislators have filed a handful of bills that curtail HOA powers, including limiting their ability to foreclose on property and ending bans on solar panels. HOA proponents agree that the system needs review, but promise to push back at changes that threaten associations' authority. Politico: ''To understand the dissatisfaction on the right with the current crop of Republican presidential hopefuls, look no further than Mike Pence .
